dialogues.text: Look, the whole thing was my fault. Let's drop it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth throws up her hands, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, lunch, you win. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're only going because I gave you a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilt is a powerful force. Just be glad it's on our side for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how is the Kidney Bean at noon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awful, just like every other time of day. Their food is just birdseed prepared fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fabulous Diner, then. Friday at noon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Max finds his old slot on the schedule and crosses it out. Then he slips into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shitbox pulls up. Sam drives, Max rides shotgun. Scott Amanda are in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I got to thinking, you know, I really think I like vanilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns off the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out and go into the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter an aisle and Sam grabs various items as he tal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen called yesterday, while we were at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call her back? 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I went over there to talk again today. She's taking it hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having dinner tonight. Wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put me in the middle of this. Are you definitely broken up? Because it seems a little up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're definitely broken up. I guess sometimes it seems like we're sliding back into our old patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes some Vaseline from a shelf. Max looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you think. I need a petroleum jelly for the polymers class I'm TA-ing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a rack of condoms catches his eye. Max sees it t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-the-heck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a box. His arms are totally full now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a basket. Hold this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dumps his pile of stuff into Max's arms, the Vaseline condoms on top, and disappears around a corner. Max sighs turns around... and bumps into Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Big night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, it's for a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would hope so. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seriously, I just got a job at a petting zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the best part is, it's work study. I think the Psych. department's involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's my new major. I got so sick of Soc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, got any plans tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a great local band playing the Pub. You should come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, sure. Might be cool to catch a band before success ruins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'll see you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves with a wave. Sam turns the other corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No baskets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe what you just did to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie was just here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Scott arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I need socks. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing sitting in the car then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda and Scott are alone in the back. Amanda looks tens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that, sometimes, you're really cool and other times you act like I'm not even here. Or like you don't want me around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was wondering if... never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, look, I'm just going to come right out with it. I think I like you. I think I, I really like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she opens her mouth, Scott opens the car door and exit 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are the socks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An absurd metal band plays on-stage. The room is packed, the crowd is mostly one big mosh pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wades through the slamdancers, freaked. He makes it t the coffee bar. Julie soon appears, sweaty. She's been he awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey! It's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surging crowd shoves Max into Julie. They fall agains each other. Max is near panic but Julie's laughing, getti off on the energy of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SINGER smashes the mic against the wall, then brandis the stand menacingly at the crowd, who step back in alarm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Anhedonia. They're "sludge-core."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all a part of the conspiracy! You're all human! Every one of you wore diapers! You're all full of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The singer storms off. The band follows. The crowd applau with some confusion. Julie whistles loudly and claps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's their trademark. They insult the crowd at the end of the set. Sometimes he breaks the mike two songs in. We were lucky: they played for almost 40 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck had nothing to do with it. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the mike's not even broken. They were just tired of playing, but they wanted to give us something to remember. Now that's showmanship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to wonder about any band whose highlight is their exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked for The Who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, the who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha. Come on, is that the kind of a joke a celebrity DJ would make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't believe you tuned in. It's like an invasion of privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a riot. Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lounge is empty. Julie sits on a couch. Max sits next her, but seems uptight about getting too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, I'm sorry about that thing with, uh, Chip was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mark. He's been following me around for years. He's easily threatened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lucky, I, uh, almost pulled a Jackie Chan on his ass, but, you know, my kung- fu's gotten rusty since I left the Hong Kong military.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about him, he isn't a threat. You're far more interesting. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Asking me not to worry is like asking a bear to use toilet paper. There's this joke that sums it up for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie leans in and looks at him with intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fooling me, you know. I can see right through this aloof image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not an insult. I get the sense that there's this whole other side of your personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he's a better dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, this is the side you show, playing everything off as a joke whenever things gets serious. But there's more to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you about the bear and the rabbit in the woods--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick. Now. Tell me something about yourself, something I never would have guessed. And don't even try to come up with some witty retort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, agape, is on the spot, helpless. Julie grabs her coa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. (a deep breath) We barely know each other, but you're all I think about. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off-balance, covering) I said something I never would have guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks. I bare my soul and now you're the funny one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. That wasn't quite what I was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's your turn, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see. Okay, here's one: I have a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. I sure hadn't guessed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, not anymore. Eric and I were together in high school, but we broke up over break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since high school, wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's kind of a jerk. It was all a waste of time. Sometimes I, I, I don't know, Max, why don't you have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the spot) Uh, I have a friend who says it's because I watch Annie Hall too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. That film practically raised me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it has a very positive message, too. I wish more guys were into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful what you wish for. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what I'm wishing for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowtires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, there are a lot of girls that would go for a guy like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of those moments, in a movie, when a character has a chance to say something, and of course they do, and it's perfect, and it becomes a movie moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie starts to lean in. Suddenly, the BUILDING MANAGER w in. He's a dead ringer for Woody Allen. Max starts violen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Building's closing. Everyone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits. Max is beside himself. Julie sees that the mome over and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I know this place. Their food is bad, but they compensate by being overpriced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, did that guy look like...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernest Borgnine? Yeah, I noticed that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is relaxed and chatting while Julie drives. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been able to do it since high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a scary gift. I mean, even if people are destined to break up, the will to stay together is very powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the real tragedy. Look at all the unhappy couples in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if your gift is really that special, Max. I mean, we break up with everyone we ever date... Until the one we stay with forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how ridiculous dating is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get this attitude if you love Annie Hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? That's what Annie's all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie looks dubious. Max flicks on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."college radio for the masses," and that's it for me. (sound of CDs falling) Whoops! Anyway, next up is Verbal Diarrhea, with Todd Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is your radio set to the campus station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's stuck on it. It's how I first heard your show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Beth told you about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter, Max. Now that I've met you, your show's not important. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of place that's perfect for Parents Weekend. At late hour, it is filled with young professionals. There's dance floor, where couples dance to the standards. Max an Julie are at a table in the corner, looking out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a nice place. Ritzy. Interesting mix of people here, you've got these men with their suits, taking their waitress girlfriends out to impress them into bed, because they can't get them any other way. Really, as if a fast car can ever make up for a small dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it did, do you think I'd be here? I'd be down at the Porsche dealer with a ski mask and an Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, always obsessed with dick size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sure, there's that, but it would also be nice to have a car with a heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's guess which couples are destined to break up. How about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indicates a COUPLE dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't tell just by looking. I need some info.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their waitress, DONNA, arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Do you have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is aghast. Donna stares a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need to know? 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, just a description.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Describe him for us. It's okay, I'm a psyche major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's tall... ish. Brown hair. Funny. Very friendly. Fixes cars. Close with his brother. Uh, what else? Believes in God. Has a sweet tooth. Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can I take your order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not ready, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna puts her pad away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what was that all about then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max here thinks you're going to break up with your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. It's all in there. You qualified "tall" so as not to make him appear too handsome, said "friendly" like a euphemism, chose "fixes cars" instead of the more dignified "auto mechanic," and finally, mentioned his brother ГЎ propos of nothing, like you're threatened by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress looks like she's been slapped. After a pause she turns her back and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Don't shoot the messenger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm such an idiot. She's going to shit in our food now. I can't believe you asked her that. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we're all people here, right? If you want to talk to someone, talk to them. I don't spend my time trying to justify talking to people or whatever. You limit yourself if you do that. If you spend too much time worrying, you don't spend enough time living, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, a fortune cookie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to keep yourself open to possibilities in life. I'm the first one in my family to go to college. Sometimes I can't believe I'm here, at a semi- prestigious university getting a halfway- decent education-- this has always been my dream. How did you end up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a coupon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean, financial aid is a bitch. And the university experience itself is kind of disappointing. All those rich students with no idea how lucky they are. But I don't think about them. I think about me, I think about where I want to be someday: a world traveler, running some huge company, or, you know, doing some fantastically important work. And when the day comes that I can relax, I'm going to charter a boat, sail around the world, and see the Seven Wonders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they broke up when Stevie left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, aren't you curious about the world? Doesn't the sheer scope of life fill you with wonder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder, horror, it's such a fine line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Max...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's smiling at him, and he can't help but return it 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy sleeps while the TV proclaims golf products. Max co in and quietly shuts it off. Tommy gurgles and rolls over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...swallowed a bug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max goes to his room. Sam's bed is empty. He shakes his h picks up a key from his desk, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits on a stool, as in the beginning, but this time w are PUSHING IN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I look around and wonder where the hell my friends came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Sam are in each other's faces, yelling. Tommy w a book and Sam waves a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like, the other night Tommy and Sam nearly got into a fistfight over whether the X-Files is based on a true story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles makes out with a GIRL in a stall covered in color paper. She has a cigarette on a black holding stem, which brushes the paper.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Before that, Scott covered the entire bathroom in multi-colored post-it notes, which Charles somehow set on fire, nearly getting us kicked out of housing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, Sam, Scott, and Tommy are there, reading fanclub newsletters: X-philes, Font-ain of Youth, Men Are From Ma Women From Venus. Charles walks in, arm in arm with a wom who is obviously a PROFESSOR, and escorts her to his room

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They're great friends. I feel safer among them than among my own family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX (V.O.) (cont'd) They always know what not to say, how not to make things uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, the group resumes reading like nothing happened... except Max, who can't believe what he just sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max in CLOSE-UP. Over his shoulder, images of Beth arguin with him from various moments in their history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even when Beth was part of the group, she didn't fit in. Like, she never just lets things be. She always has to know exactly what I'm thinking. It was sort of cute when we were friends, but now it's like a proctology exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to imagine a friendship going more wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image of Beth STOPS on a shot of her looking at him w undisguised disappointment. She DISSOLVES into a image of Julie, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but Julie. Juliejuliejulie. She's smart, she's funny, isn't constantly hassling me. How she can stay such a dreamer is beyond me... Hey, I wonder if she's listening now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thought stops him cold. The image over his shoulder VANISHES, replaced with a plain cement wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ZOOM OUT fast. Max is back in reality, the station cro and claustrophobic. He tries to regroup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps the mike) Hello? Uh, Julie...? (clears his throat) So, uh, as I was saying... Um. My friends. Yeah. My friends are weird. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time for some music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs for a CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: white on black: "THURSDAY" 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Charles stir their coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' hate this flavored shit. Anyway, I can't believe the cat in the shag jacket was Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I knew him as a freshman, he was pre- law... Whew. Anyway, it sounds like things are going well between you and Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is a real change of pace. Staying away from Annie Hall is like some kind of magic trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering about that. You seem different lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how when things are going badly, there are certain parts I like to watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like how you spent your whole sophomore year watching that lobster scene on repeat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized that I don't know what part to watch when things are going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I actually regret mentioning that theory. In fact, Sam and I were thinking of watching it tonight. You in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you on crack? I meet a girl I really like, that I may actually have a chance with, and you want me to put it all in jeopardy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Watching it without you would be weird. Unnatural. That film is you, Max, face it. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's ruining my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles drinks his coffee and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Max. I have to tell you something. I scored last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? The theory works for you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max drops his coffee, thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't premeditated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you sleep with Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, nobody knows about it. It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happen again? Of course not! That might constitute a relationship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is at a loss. The CASHIER looks over suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Max. I wasn't sure if you'd care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care! Oh God, this is my fault! If only I hadn't called her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? I'm sorry, man. Let me pay for your coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to leave. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going back to the suite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno where I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, distressed, passes the campus theater, where someone tacking up a poster for Annie Hall. Max sees it and avert his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks past the Kidney Bean. Something catches his eye through the window. He changes direction and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sees Beth eating alone at a table, reading a Tom Robb book. He walks over. Beth isn't thrilled to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max? What are you doing here? A sudden craving for bird-seed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I figured I'd had enough actual food this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, be careful, someone in the corner is eating egg salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits down across from her. After an awkward pause:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason. Something about you sounded different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually, last night on the... Oh no, he's here. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just left him in the General Store...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she isn't talking about Charles: she's looking across room at STEVE, a good-looking guy who is talking to a GIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he with? He never calls me anymore. I think he might be seeing someone. Have you heard anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know him. What's so special about this guy, anyway? I mean, are you and he...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. Well, no, I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know something's going on. I'm such a fool. Why are we always attracted to people that are completely wrong for us? Is it because they excite us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. You know, we should try to be more exciting. Like the other day, I waited until the last minute before returning a video. And next time, I swear I'm not going to rewind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be a rebel too. The other day I went to bed without flossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, are we pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's pathetic, but we're okay, you know? But sometimes, I feel like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts on her coat and gathers her things on her tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're here, Max. I didn't realize how much I missed you. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel the same way about the Sex Pistols. Missing them is far cooler than having them around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks dubiously at Max, who waves his arms and shouts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you saw Julie with someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that. Nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. They were having lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was he? What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over-reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could she see someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even dating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we might be! I can't handle competition, Sam, I'm not the competitive type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just lunch in the cafeteria. He looked completely normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't compete with that! (he fumbles with his coat) Man, it's all gone so wrong, so fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes out the door. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max knocks on the door to Julie's suite. Nothing. He pace frustrated. Suddenly, JUDY comes out of a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, do you know where Julie is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Are you Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow! You're just like she described. Hi, I'm Judy. I'm sure she mentions me all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, Judy. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy unlocks the door and holds it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, come in. Make yourself at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters cautiously. The common room couldn't be more different than his own, clean and tasteful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy hangs her coat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may be completely inappropriate, but can I ask you something? The tattooВ­ did it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhhh... No! I mean, not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you use your frat's logo? 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, the guy said it's too hard to draw two grown men kissing. Say, which one is Julie's room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the left. She's got the single.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pushes Julie's door open with one hand while keeping eye on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...! Uh, do I come here often, would you say?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Julie enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy let me in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy comes out of her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think I'm going to get a tattoo, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, Mark has the tattoo. This is Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, isn't he great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glaring at him, she goes into her room and closes the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a surprise! What brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was, uh, in the area and thought I'd pop in. Find out how your day went. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was excellent, how was yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I had lunch with a dear, dear friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Anyone I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not. She's a foreign exchange student. Spends a lot of time modeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the agencies won't leave her alone. We had, uh, quite a lunch. Lots of shellfish, and wine. And, uh, rhino's horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, uh, she's on the kosher meal plan. Look, I gotta go. Nice seeing you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He splits, leaving Julie wondering what that was all abou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Max beats himself in the forehead several times. Then, a picture of misery, he trudges off--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in on someone doing a show. He leaves dejectedly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back to his suite, where Sam and Jen sit like statues, watching "The X-Files." He makes a quick exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passes by Julie's dorm again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually finds himself approaching the University Cente 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ska band plays "These Boots Were Made For Walking" befo two small lines of skanking rude boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles is alone at the bar. Max sits down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made an ass of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is it the weekend already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Your troubles don't compare. Sara blew up at Stacy and nearly destroyed our first rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you've got real problems. Do you have time to talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, here she comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles! Can you believe Stacy at rehearsal?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps on the stool next to him. Charles turns to Max help but he's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: white on black: "FRIDAY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max plays video hockey. Charles comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studying for a test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't talk, theater major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I have a test on lighting next week that'll make your hair go grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sprawls on the couch. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for bailing on me last night. I had to hear Sara gab for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just leave? At least you can escape your problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got my textbooks for this term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max holds up a thick book, Post-Modern Semiology. The ent cover is a still from Annie Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the gods give you a sign like that, there's only one thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes a controller to Charles and they play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I saw Julie last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you count this huge purse she had. She was rummaging through it and finally had to dump the thing out. I swear, I'm surprised Kennedy's brain didn't fall out of that thing. Anyway, it made me think of Annie Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although Julie dresses better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max slowly lowers his controller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, I like her because she's like Annie Hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I think you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to like someone because she reminds me of someone in a movie. Now I'm wondering why I like her. Maybe I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Lord, Max. Take some harder classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam returns, sees what they are playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you two. Wouldn't something else be fun for a change? How about Goldeneye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't know how to play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for you, I actually have time to teach you. Normally I would be having lunch with Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, I forgot about lunch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets up and runs out. Charles and Sam exchange a look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, he'll do anything to avoid change, won't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is alone, working on a salad. Max runs up and jumps the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) So glad you could make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for small favors. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Are you still upset about the thing with Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a little. This semester isn't shaping up too well. It's tough getting back into the groove of things and, you know, being on campus. Yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know. Nothing even worth mentioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's something? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Do I know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, um, yeah, it's Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie! She's great. Why aren't you thrilled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not sure I'm that into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This I gotta hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reminds everyone of Annie Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course, why do you think I sent her to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'm such an idiot! That film is finding more and more ways to ruin my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pounds his head against the table but Beth is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my life. Look at this thing with Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, she's not like Annie when the film starts, she's like Annie at the end. Or maybe, the Millennium Edition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst part is, maybe I knew this all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, what's really the problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Annie Hall's not even my type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a type?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm into bipeds with most of their teeth. No Lutherans or fictional characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would you rather sleep with, Julie or Annie Hall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not two choices, that's one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Annie Hall or me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max knocks over her soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop delaying. This is a serious hypothetical question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I must admit, it would be... Annie Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth snorts, then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel bad, you came in second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take what I can get. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only because you'd laugh at more of my jokes in bed. It adds a whole other dimension-- you'd be laughing with me in addition to at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You joke while you're in bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's weird because I do the same thing. Guys find it annoying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls think I'm a loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie doesn't. And you really like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's corny, but there's something about her that brings me happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happiness? Max, you wouldn't know what to do with it if you had it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max frantically cleans up all the pizza boxes, wrappers, empties. Charles leans on the wall, arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, either go somewhere else, or stay in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I even meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already did. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stuff the trash with paper, squirts lighter fluid all over it, and takes Annie Hall from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's coming over to watch a movie. I don't want to take any chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries the tape over the trash but Charles snatches i from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, Sam and I were gonna watch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, he puts it back on the shelf and goes to his roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell RINGS. Max smooths his hair one last time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Julie browse a shelf full of videos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Scott joined a video club, we've got a lot of shitty movies you'll ever Oo, here's Buffalo `66, that's a need. great flick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, but I saw it a couple of weeks ago. I don't think I can sit through it again. You mentioned something about Annie Hall the other night. Do you have that lying around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that it on the end there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no, it's just the box. The tape inside is wrestling. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, it's been recorded over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe your friend's theory, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's insulting. A cop-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, I know, it's just, I watched it last week. How about Airplane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good idea. But next time, Annie Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max puts in Airplane. Julie and Max sit on a couch togeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airplane plays. Julie and Max share a blanket. Max turns toward Julie just as she turns toward him, and their lips up in the same place. Julie pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are youВ­?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you back away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me, I wouldn't have backed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I'll, I'll have to remember that later. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns back to the movie. A beat passes. Julie looks a him, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, my memory's not what it used to be. If I don't act on this information now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. Max pulls the blanket up over them. The sound KISSING. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More KISSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you comfortable, I mean, is this okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Shut up already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the sound of a LOCK TURNING. Max and Julie quic get out from under the covers. Sam and Tommy enter, obliv to the quick recovery of innocence on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! You know how important your sense of smell is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! What about touch? Missing the smell of rotting milk is hardly equal to not being able to enjoy sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Guys, um, this is Julie. Julie, this is my roommate Sam, and that's Tommy, who also lives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you guys, but I was just leaving. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have work to do before class tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the movie is... Okay. Do you want me to walk you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, all right. Boys, nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max leaves with Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so what about body odor, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Julie collapse onto the pillows, exhausted from s Her room is extremely disorganized, decorated in an idiosyncratic mix of punk rock icons and nature scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I smoked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. It's strangely sexy when guys smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it's the only thing between me and my dream of becoming Steve McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie in each other's warmth, under the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You and Beth are pretty close, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call that pillow talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to be. There were times I would have been lost without her. Other times, it was like the lost leading the lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She really cares about you. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried something once, but it was a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great that you're still friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I'm not sure if I have a say in it. On a campus this small, it's like she's everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes this place annoys me. There's so much bullshit. My semester off was the right idea. What happened to old- fashioned hard work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what summers are for. The school year is for reckless debauchery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I have to get going. I'll never get my homework done if I sleep all weekend. Ah, fuck it, who cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not just set your tuition on fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, coming from the girl who thinks college is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max just lies there, comfortably resting with a small smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, get on up, lazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits up and puts one foot on the floor before realizi he'll be naked if he stands. He tries to grab his jeans w his toes. Julie observes him dryly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be shy, after, you know...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's different. Some things aren't quite as impressive in the light of day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a problem with nudity. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. I'm a big fan of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max picks up his pants. Julie taps him on the shoulder an flicks the sheet up to flash him. He starts and drops the She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max puts his jeans on, shoves his underwear and socks in pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A double-shift, I get out at five. This week's gonna suck. I have homework that can't be avoided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is dressed. They smooch. Max leaves. Julie lies in be thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Cave begins to croon "Into My Arms"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max leaves the building and stops to look at the winter sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: black on white: "SATURDAY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe In an interventionist God But I know, darling That you do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students work in the library as light refracts through icicles in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I did I would kneel down and ask Him Not to intervene When it came to you 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy and a girl hold hands as they cross an icy street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squirrels play in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun reflects off the University Center windows and ba onto the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to touch a hair on your head To leave you as you are But if He felt He had to direct you Direct you into my arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are low. Max is at the console, staring into space. Nick Cave is playing softly on the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into my arms... oh Lord... Into my arms... oh Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Max snaps out of his reverie and stares it in horror. After several rings, he answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Nobody is here right now. Please leave a message. BEEEEEEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLIT SCREEN between Max and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, in bed, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try, Max. I thought you had homework and stuff, you liar. Great song, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're listening? I told you not to listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you're funny, you have good taste in music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where'd the music go? 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two STUDENTS, lying in bed together, listen to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the radio) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the radio) I don't get it, it stopped when I picked up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pushes up a slider and hears the following coming out over the monitors:

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm just calling to say that you left your underpants and took mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max reacts, then SCREECHING FEEDBACK rips over the airwav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue SPLIT SCREEN with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Julie is frantically pulling the chord out of the b of her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max fades the phone out, the music up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be too proud of your five seconds of fame. More people would hear us if we shouted out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My radio days are over, I'm now deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I tell you not to listen to my show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were only playing music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all these songs are about you. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... You're a real piece of work, you know that, Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters and takes off his coat. Sam sits up, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'm sorry. Go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? I have to be up in 15 minutes anyway. Not that I could sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sleep either, but for some reason I'm still refreshed. I feel great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Julie. Last night we officially became a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officially?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hooked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It meant something to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam considers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. Just last week you told me the happy should be quarantined. I don't know you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still down about Jen, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We broke up for good last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of bed and starts dressing. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I knew what I was doing. Ever since she became my girlfriend, I've felt more and more constricted. Like I was trapped under the weight of the label. "My girlfriend." "Her boyfriend."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys were together a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun in Saturday lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, eat shit and die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is alone, playing "Goldeneye" with a dopey smile on h face. Charles comes in, rolls of blueprints under his arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this, "Goldeneye"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles sits and they play against each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been here all day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this game's so much fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, gotta tell you, you're really creeping me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy comes out of his room, dressed in a shirt and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam said the same thing. He's still depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still can't believe he broke up with Jen. I saw her yesterday and she looked sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked her how she was doing, and she said "Fine," and asked me why I was asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A non-denial denial. I invented that. She's learned from the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her, too. She didn't seem upset to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles kills Max with a rocket launcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hanging with Sara. That girl pisses me off! She'll say the dumbest things, like, the Breeders are better than the Beatles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happiness is a warm gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't go that far. She's just a daffy dame, that's all. Now, Stacy's foxy, but she's too serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes in, totally morose. Silently, he joins them in three-player mode, then quickly kills himself with a rock launcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just came from Jen's, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we just broke up for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I'm sorry. Was it you or her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. Us. Both. It was just time, I guess. (puts down the joystick) I have to go, uh, mail a letter or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his coat and leaves. Charles, Tommy, and Max exchange looks. Max turns off the game. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that took the wind out of my sails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with you? Got another date with Amanda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A no-show, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's okay. Today's her birthday, and she invited me out for dinner at a nice restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She invited all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Well, that's cool, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's barely lunch, why are you dressed up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to wait til the last minute to pick out my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really wearing that tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, I knew this was the wrong one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs into his room. Charles laughs at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go to a birthday party. I'm broke, and I wanna hang out with Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So take her. And pray Sara's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Julie walk through the snow together, toward a parking lot. She's taking deep drags off a cigarette. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been some crazy week. I still have a six page paper due Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six pages? That's nothing. Triple spaced, in 14 point type, that's only like 500 words. If a picture's worth a thousand words, that's like a bad photocopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, I needed a break. Good to get out and enjoy the weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, from Maine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phew, because I don't know if I'd be able to handle something like that. That's a hard thing to drop on a person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from northern Vermont. Not too far from Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sucked but I managed. Read a lot. Had a few close friends. That's all you need. It's quiet up there, dull but nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to her car, and he surprises her by kissing her. responds, after a hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits tensely in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out for that truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck's about two blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you relax? I know how to drive. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the driveway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it under control, Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, everyone's dying to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be fun. All my friends, meeting my girlfriend. It's going to be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just call me your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah well, I guess that's alright. Boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Max and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN around a long table: Beth at one end, then Jen and Sam, Charles (looking annoyed) and Sara, Tommy at the oth end, then Scott and Amanda, and two chairs. Everyone's talking and looking at menus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Julie enter. Max looks around, paranoid. He sees Donna the waitress glaring at him, and hurries after Juli who is already at the table introducing herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I can't believe you're graduating so early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, really? 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've spent my life learning how to be a student, and at the end of the semester it will all be useless. Everybody already wants to know what I'm going to do, and I have no idea. I started making up stories to tell people. An aunt asked me if I'm excited about Chicago, and I couldn't remember if I'd said I was moving to the city or going to see the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something similar once happened to me, except I didn't know Nashville Pussy was a band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy laughs and blows tea out his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm graduating. My whole life, I've known what was next. But when I graduate, the next step is... something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that pays the bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandfather once told me that if you love your job, you'll never work a day in your life. He's 98 years old, addicted to C-SPAN, and had to be removed from a supermarket recently for shouting about Republicans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know where you get it from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should do whatever makes you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grad school baby. Stay out of the real world as long as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Jen sit close together and are both subdued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm graduating next year. I already have a recurring nightmare about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have plenty of time, dear. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rubs his arm soothingly. Behind her back, Charles rol his eyes and sticks his finger down his throat. Sara sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Charles, show a little dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whirls on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignity? You've been following me around like a lost dog since break, and you're talking about dignity?! You're always in my way, I can't get away from you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're making me sick, that's my business! Leave me alone already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms out. The table is aghast. Julie averts her eye politely. Beth pokes Max, urging him to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make you sick? Sam, say something to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I? We've made him sick for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth smacks Max's leg: Do something! He begs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think everything's okay if it's true, but some things are true and not okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to realize I'm a different person and entitled to my opinion? It's my goddamn life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen turns away, glaring. Max anxiously looks at Julie, wh stares above her menu. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, guys, it's my birthday. We're here to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Can't we all just get along?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Scott, I am so sick of you making fun of me! You are the meanest person I've ever met and I don't know why anybody even talks to you! You are such an asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lock gazes for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara comes back in and sits down, sullen. There is a long uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready to order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsure, he turns to the next couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter looks around, notices the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... So... Julie. I heard you switched majors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm Psych now. I didn't like Soc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Soc. major. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sorry, I just meant, I needed something more, ya know, relevant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psych is relevant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look, I'm only in college for the degree. Most of the stuff they teach us is pointless anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie looks at Max: Say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heheh, I bet that's why they call it "academic."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College is a great opportunity. It's about more than getting a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's about avoiding the real world for as long as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work in theater, so this is great training for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call theater the real world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Julie is hitting Max's leg: Help me out here! But Max petrified, watching his worst nightmare unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us work really hard to get through school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, my parents worked their whole lives to give me the opportunity to be here. But the truth is, private schools like ours make money by showing students a good time for four years. It's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think social work is bullshit? 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This "bullshit" is going to put me in debt for the next forty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie punches Max in the thigh. He jumps, blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just drop out if everything's such bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's everybody going to order then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. What a bunch of spoiled, whiny college brats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody has anything more to say. Everyone looks away. Max shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna work for NASA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's car pulls up. Her bumper sticker: "EAT ANIMALS, D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max opens the door, gets halfway out, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. I just need a few hours to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fun, just the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie lights a cigarette off her old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max straightens up. Scott comes out of his bedroom. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she stands you up, are we still not allowed in here? It's my time to watch "South Park."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would she do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already past eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets the door. Scott exits, disappointed. Julie enter smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry I'm late. You wouldn't believe what cross-campus traffic was like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the worst excuse I ever heard. I mean it. So... you wanna hit the video store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you've got something here that I've been looking forward to all week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Annie Hall from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shit, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must face your fears. Relax, it's a very positive film. You just have to know how to look at it. It's really refreshingly positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closing credits are rolling. Max and Julie look somew disconcerted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, what an uplifting movie. Such a refreshingly positive message. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think I prefer Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that? Annie Hall is so uplifting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just deeper, more sophisticated, I guess. Listen, thanks for dinner and the movie tonight, but I should get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's still early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie goes to the door. Max follows. He tries to kiss her She pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if this is a good idea right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how about right... now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to kiss her again. She ducks it, comes back into room, sits down. Max stands, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, since the other night, I've been doing some thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your mistake. Mindless happiness is always better than thoughtful reservation. Unless you're talking about nude bungee jumping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that this is a good time for us to jump, or leap, or whatever, you know, together. Into a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, but... we just saw a movie about how relationships are worth it, no matter what happens. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess we really did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're right, Max, and this relationship was worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was? Is. Wait... Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max covers his face, breathes deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Will you please calm down? I like you very much, but I told you, I just got out of a serious relationship, and it ended really badly. We saw each other almost every day at the beginning, but by the end of the semester, I hadn't seen him in a month. He stopped returning my calls and stuff, and I mean, he basically avoided me, then I heard he was seeing one of my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was him, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nobody's fault, I know. I mean, I've been trying but it's hard. Relationships are very difficult to maintain. There are so few successful couples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's successful? Like, my parents have been married thirty years, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, bad example. But why think ahead? We're here, now. Can't we just enjoy our time together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, I did, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was all this, I mean, was any of itВ­ 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I was doing. I didn't think about where this might lead until it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it might lead to... happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy walks in, half asleep, in his pajamas. He turns on TV and sits down. Max stares at him. Tommy suddenly reali he isn't alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, re-run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns it off and quickly exits. Max tries to pull hims together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that damn film was cursed! Why did I listen to Charles instead of Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Max. It's not an anti-relationship movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? It's a fucking textbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me, Max. Just like you're not listening to Annie. No matter what you think right now, this was worth it. Because I got to meet you, and got to be close to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I don't know. I mean... Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie leaves. The VCR whirs to a stop and Annie Hall ejec Max stares at it, upset and thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: white on black: "SUNDAY" 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN left to right across people's chests: an X-Files shir lounge shirt with a wide collar, a Stephen Hawking shirt, Ani DiFranco shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal, l to r, Sam, Charles, Tommy and Aman sprawled on the couches, from Max's POV in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're drinking vodka out of coffee mugs. The TV is on b the sound is off. Everyone looks tired and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits. Sam thumbs a copy of Scientific American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are humans smarter than chimps if we have 99% of the same genetic material?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says we're smarter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who I'm asking. You think a red blood cell is a prison for a gang member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, Mr. Wizard. If I learned anything useful in my classes, I'd be rubbing it in your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Scott's usual spot is Amanda and Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Amanda. Have a good weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine was good too. Get any good birthday presents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, Max, what ever happened with that girl you were seeing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
