dialogues.text: She just ended a long relationship and she doesn't want anything serious. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you have something that's not so serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's dead. And the thing I don't get is, it was all going so well. There was a moment when we kissed, when it was more than a kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His openness is making the other guys uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like we broke through all our layers, you know, all the manners and defense mechanisms and daily crap, and I saw a flash of something, a glimmer of hope or happiness or whatever, something I inspired in her. But now it's over and I'll never see that part of her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're upset about not seeing some other parts of her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The joke is half-hearted-- Max has made everyone reflecti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a girl, Max. They'll always be a mystery. You'll never know why they love you and you'll never know why they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relationships are incredibly complicated. Like polypeptide strings. There's an attraction at first, but if the bonds don't form right away, nothing can make the connection work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a metaphor we can all relate to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like with Jen and I. But I know it was for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally dropped out of the play I was directing, just to get rid of Sara. God, my career is in shambles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough week all around, huh? How about some video hockey? 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets up and puts on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I prefer Goldeneye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Sam sighs and picks up the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna watch Sports Center?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I think I'm gonna call Sara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and leaves as Sam registers this news. He puts remote down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is moist and foggy as Max trudges across the deserted campus.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stops in the middle of a path as Beth walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. Happy Valentine's Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oo, witty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hate Valentine's Day, too. If you're in love, you're in love. And if you're not, who wants to think about it? I want to be in love so badly, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there's this joke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, forget it, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a bear shit in the woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's the one. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told it the night of our date. I hate that joke, Max. It's not a philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think I know what it means now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it's dreary and depressing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I just want to say, before it's all over and I don't have the chance, that I'm sorry. For everything. Last semester and last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is speechless; she never though she'd ever hear that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the world to me, and I was an idiot to throw it away. You were right: if I can't be a friend to you, how could I be a boyfriend? I've done a lot of things wrong, and I've been confused as hell, but I think it's time for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks him over, as if for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then allow me to recommend a movie that you've never seen before. It's called Annie Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to see it tonight. Do you want to join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would love to, but I think you need to do this alone. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll see you later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. After the movie, I'm doing my last radio show. It's going to be all requests. You should tune in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of an era.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The start of a new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and walks away. The fog begins to obscure him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth opens her backpack and removes a Walkman. She hits P and the LED changes from TAPE to RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX (V.O.) (cont'd) And that's how I let go of her. Although, it's probably more honest to say that she let go of me. Julie, Beth, and Annie. Three women in my life and I was desperate for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE. Beth stands alone, watching him go. She sn the headphones over her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX (V.O.) (cont'd) Of course, I saw her again. It's a small campus. The last time was at a film festival. We're better friends now then ever, and there's always a chance we can have some kind of future together. So far, so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Beth turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT BACK TO: Max still walking, getting smaller and small Soon all we see is fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX (V.O.) (cont'd) She'll always mean a lot to me, and it's nice to run into her and reminisce about what we, ya know, went through. It was a weird period of my life. I mean, shit, I really got off track there, didn't I?
